posts.post_content:
This was the planeswalker I was least excited about for Scars. She just didn't look that fun or fantastic to me.  
  
Then she ended up in my pre-release Sealed pool. It was very awkward, like when in high school you would get paired up for a group project with someone you talk a lot of crap about behind their back. But turns out this card is phenomenal, and then I got a 2nd one in one of my prize packs at the end. Like, you know, when you're done with the group project and find out that person is actually pretty cool, and you share a lot of common interests.  
  
Pretty sure her -2 slows games down faster than any activated ability in the history of Magic.

But turns out this card is phenomenal, and then I got a 2nd one in one of my prize packs at the end. Like, you know, when you're done with the group project and find out that person is actually pretty cool, and you share a lot of common interests.

Pretty sure her -2 slows games down faster than any activated ability in the history of Magic.

Posted By: Troutz (10/4/2010 8:39:09 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Part of me really likes the design of this card and the rest of me is too consumed with hate at even the idea of having to play against her to give a damn about design.   
  
While I lean towards saying Elspeth, Knight-Errant is better, she's still plenty amazing. Even outside of a token deck, this is an absolute powerhouse. I generally at least try to avoid labeling cards as broken, but a reusable nuke that hits enchantments, artifacts, non-token creatures, and all other plainswalkers more than pushes the limit for me.

I pulled one, and traded it for a few more expensive cards to add to my RDW (Kuldotha), although I did go 3 - 0 in a draft thanks to this card, only owning 1 does me no good and its was too expensive for me to buy another one. =/ Overall its a great card that can win games, but you need to build a deck around it.

posts.post_content:
compared to other cards, all Planeswalkers should get 4.5/5. the remaining .5 goes to cards from ye-olde-stupide--broekn-commbo-dayes with Black Lotus & Co.  
  
But even among Planeswalkers, Elspeth is kind of a Viking Goddess. No reason not to rate for 5, really, except out of deference to history.  
  
Personally, I want to see a Duel Decks: Elspeth Tirel VS Sorin Markov.   
  
I feel they would not get along, Elspeth would get all self-righteous Buffy the Vampire Slayer on Sorin's undead butt. They both have giant swords, and we'd love to see them hack at each other :)   
  
Of course, I'd root for Sorin, but I'd enjoy another Elspeth Duel Decks product as well. The last Elspeth deck felt a bit...lacking, somehow.

Posted By: Xilinoc (6/10/2011 4:45:21 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@holloweencandies Planewalkers are powerful and game changing, but they're also easy to get rid of. Pretty much every blue counter spell can keep it from hitting the field. Burn spells from red can shoot down Elspeth. White has O Ring, and even green has an out with beast within. Black probably has the hardest time with planeswalker hunting, but can still hunt one out of the hand, and with blue, can counter/surgical extraction any planeswalker.  
  
And of course, you can always attack the planeswalker, though evasion is really important against someone like Eslpeth. As a rule, planeswalkers are as fragile as they are powerful.
posts.html:

Burn spells from red can shoot down Elspeth. White has O Ring, and even green has an out with beast within. Black probably has the hardest time with planeswalker hunting, but can still hunt one out of the hand, and with blue, can counter/surgical extraction any planeswalker.

And of course, you can always attack the planeswalker, though evasion is really important against someone like Eslpeth. As a rule, planeswalkers are as fragile as they are powerful.

Posted By: holloweencandies (3/2/2012 11:44:38 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
My good friend gave me one of these for free. I have now have 2 of them, and she'll be my favorite Planeswalker forever, both in card and character.   
  
To be honest, I've never really used her -2. Running a token deck, I usually feel like I have enough creatures by the time she comes out, generally about 6-8, and her bomb only takes 2 turns to get out WHILE still keeping her around. I just use her +2 to brace for the "Oh shit, I need to do something big" attack that's coming from the opponent, and when they fail to deliver, -5.   
  
And that's usually game. I just don't have time to ever use her -2, oh well. Still handy to have, I suppose. Just in case.

Posted By: raptorman333 (2/14/2012 12:59:48 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I was playing a Scars of Mirrodin draft with my friends. I was building a black/blue deck, and then I opened this up on my last booster.  
I took it immediately.  
  
On a more serious note though, I'm really digging the 2nd ability, so much utility! It can be used as chump blockers to defend Elspeth or if you have enough creature buffs (which is very common in soldiers/white), they're potential threats your opponents just can't ignore.  
  
The most charming aspect about her ultimate is how EASY you can get there, it's just nuts, I love it!  
  
PS : Oh, and not that anyone cares, but she is my very first planeswalker :D (I'm a magic veteran but has stopped for a while, haven't got that much mythics...let alone planeswalkers)
posts.html:
